ai.summary: Lulworth Walk 4 is an 11.9 km moderate hike in the UK, offering coastal scenery and varied terrain suitable for hikers with a reasonable fitness level.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines coastal paths, grassy fields, and occasional rocky or uneven sections. Expect some gentle climbs, potential mud in wet weather, and exposed sea views.
ai.safety_notes: - Stay on marked trails and keep a safe distance from cliff edges. - Check weather and sea conditions before you go; coastal winds can be strong and conditions change quickly. - Bring adequate clothing, water, and food. - Carry a map or offline GPS and a charged phone. - Inform someone of your plans if hiking alone.
recommended_gear: Map or offline GPS device and a charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) typically offers the best weather and sea views; summer provides longer daylight. Winter hikes can be windy, wet, and muddy with higher risk of icy ground.

seo.title: Lulworth Walk 4: 11.9 km Moderate Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Lulworth Walk 4, an 11.9 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, best seasons, and planning advice for this coastal trail.
